page.title: 01Around Corfe Castle Village
page.content:
This area is divided in two by the chalk ridgeway which runs to the ruins of Corfe Castle in the West. To the south is mixed farming. To the north is the heathland and forest running up to Wytch Farm - the largest on-shore oil field in Europe.
The village of Corfe Castle has about 1500 inhabitants, working in farming, building, quarrying and the tourist industry. Local planning regulations insist on the use of Purbeck stone for house building. This, together with the demand for second homes in this picture book village, makes house prices about 10% higher than in surrounding villages. This is a real problem for young couples, who cannot afford local houses on local incomes.
